channel.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
channel.description: I've done Web Development for years now, and I've never used DreamWeaver or programs like that, I've used Notepad++ through it all. Now that I'm starting up with some Java, everyone is talking about Eclipse, I somewhat know what it is. Eclipse is to Java, as Dreamweaver is to Web Development. That's what I can understand, except Eclipse is free. What would you guys recommend? What bonuses does Eclipse have to offer? And how could it help me?

item.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Yes, I would. It allows you to travel between classes easily, view all references of an object, gives ways to fix compilation errors, and much more.

It will not hinder, only help.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I wish eclipse would work on my computer I’m using Netbeans as a replacement and yes, it’s worth it, a hell of allot better than using notepad.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

If you learn all the keyboard shortcuts as well, you will become more efficient with your work. You can do things like rename a variable in a class, and it changes in every other class that it references (Thanks Ryley :P), and it can also format your code for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

Eclipse will show errors, compile for you, give options to make methods and find methods and a whole bunch of other stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Eclipse helps you with everything. It will construct a class for you with a main method all pre-typed by checking a box. If you forgot to import something, it will tell you to import it and let you click a button to import the class. It’s a very good IDE, but will take some time to get used to.

Read full topic

item.title: Would you recommend getting Eclipse?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Yes, for the love of god, yes.

Read full topic
